Description: Stateless API + append-only store to register evidence, parse claims, compute contradiction graphs, and emit a verifiable export manifest (hash tree + transform chain). Repo: services/prov-ledger/ (nothing outside). Milestones: M1 Contracts & fixtures; M2 Core write/read paths; M3 Contradiction graph; M4 Export manifest + CLI verifier; M5 Perf hardening & SLOs.
Acceptance Criteria: API & event fixtures stable; contract tests pass. Golden E2E: ingest->resolve->report including manifest verification. p95 latency targets met on seeded dataset. No edits beyond services/prov-ledger/*.

Description: Define contracts (ledger.proto, openapi.yaml), event schemas (claims.registered.v1, contradiction.updated.v1), and golden fixtures.
Acceptance Criteria: ledger.proto and openapi.yaml finalized; event schemas documented; golden fixtures created and versioned.

Description: Implement /evidence/register endpoint with idempotent writes and hash tree storage.
Acceptance Criteria: Endpoint returns 2xx on valid input; duplicate submissions return same hash; hash tree correctly computed.

Description: Implement /claim/parse endpoint with syntax validation and normalization.
Acceptance Criteria: Claims parsed with syntax errors reported; normalization produces canonical form; edge cases handled.

Description: Implement /claim/contradictions endpoint with graph walk algorithm. Must meet 50k nodes p95<1.5s target.
Acceptance Criteria: Graph walk returns contradictions correctly; p95 latency <1.5s on 50k node dataset; results cacheable.

Description: Implement /export/manifest endpoint producing Merkle summary and transform chain.
Acceptance Criteria: Manifest contains valid Merkle root; transform chain is complete and verifiable; deterministic output.

Description: Implement CLI ledger-verify to validate manifests offline.
Acceptance Criteria: CLI verifies manifest integrity; clear pass/fail output; works without network access.

Description: Implement outbox pattern with Kafka publishing, retry logic, and dead-letter queue.
Acceptance Criteria: Messages published reliably; retries with backoff; dead-letter captures failures; at-most-once delivery.

Description: Add OTEL instrumentation, Prometheus metrics, SLO definitions, and operational runbooks.
Acceptance Criteria: Traces exported; metrics scraped; SLO dashboards configured; runbooks documented.

Description: NL -> Cypher preview with cost/row estimates, sandbox run, diff vs manual query; >=95% syntactic validity on test corpus. Repo: plugins/nlq-copilot/. Plugin self-registers; can be disabled independently.
Acceptance Criteria: Plugin self-registers; can be disabled independently. 95% syntactic validity; zero write queries allowed. Screenshots + snapshot tests check UI determinism.

Summary: NLQ-1: Side-panel UI via module federation
Description: Implement side-panel UI using module federation; no core UI edits required.
Acceptance Criteria: Side panel renders correctly; integrates via module federation; no core UI changes.

Description: Implement /nlq/compile service: prompt -> {cypher, estimates, safety}. Read-only queries only.
Acceptance Criteria: Given NL prompt -> valid Cypher + non-empty estimate. Write queries rejected. Estimates include row/cost.

Description: Show provenance snippets; block publish without citations.
Acceptance Criteria: Citation missing -> blocked with rationale. Provenance snippets displayed for each result.

Summary: NLQ-4: Explain this view extension point
Description: Wire 'Explain this view' extension point for integration with other UI components.
Acceptance Criteria: Extension point callable from other views; returns explanation data.

Description: Create test corpus and pass@k evaluation; regression harness for syntactic validity.
Acceptance Criteria: Corpus covers common queries; pass@k metrics tracked; regression harness runs in CI.

Summary: NLQ-6: Undo/redo and diff against baseline
Description: Implement undo/redo functionality and diff view against baseline queries.
Acceptance Criteria: Undo/redo works for query history; diff view shows AST/plan differences.

Description: Deterministic + probabilistic ER with explainable scorecards, reversible merges, and human adjudication queues. Repo: services/entity-resolution/. Canonical JSON-LD facets consistent with graph model.
Acceptance Criteria: Canonical JSON-LD facets consistent with graph model. Every merge has an override log (user, reason, time). Zero shared schema edits; GraphQL exposed via stitched schema adapter.

Description: Define contracts for /er/candidates, /er/merge, /er/split, /er/explain endpoints.
Acceptance Criteria: OpenAPI spec finalized; request/response schemas documented; versioning strategy defined.

Description: Implement candidate generation using rules + embeddings hook.
Acceptance Criteria: Rules produce candidates; embeddings hook callable; candidates ranked by similarity.

Description: Implement scoring with configurable thresholds; emit er.merge.v1 events.
Acceptance Criteria: Scores computed correctly; threshold configurable; events emitted on merge decisions.

Summary: ER-4: Merge graph and reversible operations
Description: Implement merge graph with fully reversible operations and complete audit trail.
Acceptance Criteria: Merges recorded in graph; /er/split restores pre-merge state losslessly; audit trail complete.

Description: Implement /er/explain returning feature vectors and rationale.
Acceptance Criteria: Explain returns features, weights, and policy label. Human-readable rationale.

Description: Implement adjudication queue API for human review (no UI).
Acceptance Criteria: Borderline cases routed to queue; queue items retrievable via API; decisions recorded.

Summary: ER-7: Golden datasets and reproducible merges
Description: Create golden datasets; ensure reproducible merge outcomes.
Acceptance Criteria: Golden datasets cover edge cases; merges are deterministic on same input.

Description: Cross-tenant deconfliction via ZK set/overlap/range proofs; no raw PII exchanged. Repo: services/zk-tx/. Reproducible proofs; transcripts verifiable offline.
Acceptance Criteria: Reproducible proofs; transcripts verifiable offline. No PII leaves tenant boundaries in tests. Authz handled internally; no edits to shared auth.

Description: Define /zk/overlap and /zk/range endpoints with proof + transcript output.
Acceptance Criteria: Endpoints return valid ZK proofs; transcripts included; verification passes.

Description: Implement audited salts and hardware-backed entropy for key management.
Acceptance Criteria: Keys rotated without breaking verification; audit trail for key operations; HSM integration.

Summary: ZK-3: Example CLI for two tenants
Description: Create CLI demonstrating two tenants proving overlap/no-overlap.
Acceptance Criteria: CLI runs successfully; demonstrates both positive and negative overlap cases.

Summary: ZK-4: Leakage tests and selective disclosure
Description: Implement leakage tests; demonstrate selective disclosure examples.
Acceptance Criteria: No information leakage in negative tests; selective disclosure works correctly.

Description: Create federation planner stub for future push-down optimization.
Acceptance Criteria: Stub interface defined; documentation for future extension.

Description: Evaluate queries/exports against data licenses and authority/warrant bindings; block unsafe actions with clear 'why'. Repo: services/policy-engine/. Full audit chain on denies/overrides.
Acceptance Criteria: Full audit chain on denies/overrides. Adapter-only gateway integration; no core edits. Simulation produces before/after metric deltas.

Description: Implement /policy/evaluate: plan -> allow|deny + reasons + obligations.
Acceptance Criteria: Evaluation returns decision with reasons; obligations attached; performance <100ms p95.

Description: Implement /license/check: dataset, purpose -> decision + clause refs.
Acceptance Criteria: License check returns decision; specific clause references included; purpose change affects outcome.

Description: Implement override workflow with complete audit entries.
Acceptance Criteria: Overrides require justification; audit entries immutable; queryable by time/user/decision.

Summary: POL-4: Gateway adapter for reasoner messages
Description: Create read-only gateway adapter for reasoner messages.
Acceptance Criteria: Adapter-only integration; no core gateway edits; messages flow correctly.

Description: Implement simulation mode showing diff impact of policy changes.
Acceptance Criteria: Simulation produces stable diff on fixture suite; before/after comparison.

Description: SLO dashboards, OTEL/Prom telemetry, slow-query killer, budget caps - no product code edits. Repo: ops/observability-pack/ (+ new Helm under infra/helm/*). Dashboards render with synthetic + staging data.
Acceptance Criteria: Dashboards render with synthetic + staging data. One-button canary + documented rollback. Runbooks battle-tested in tabletop + chaos drill.

Description: Define OTEL instrumentation standards and code examples for services.
Acceptance Criteria: Standards documented; code examples provided; linter rules for compliance.

Summary: OPS-2: Prometheus rules and Grafana dashboards
Description: Create Prometheus rules, Grafana dashboards, and alert policies.
Acceptance Criteria: Rules validated; dashboards render; alerts fire correctly on synthetic breach.

Summary: OPS-3: Slow-query killer and budget caps
Description: Implement slow-query killer + kill switch; capped budgets with alerts.
Acceptance Criteria: Slow queries detected and auto-killed; alert includes sample. Budget cap hit -> CI blocks scale-up.

Description: Create canary/rollback scripts; Terraform/Helm modules.
Acceptance Criteria: One-button canary; documented rollback; Helm modules tested.

Description: Create runbooks for perf regression, ingest backlog, authz drift, cost spike.
Acceptance Criteria: Runbooks cover all scenarios; tested in tabletop exercise.

Summary: OPS-6: Chaos drills and pass criteria
Description: Define chaos drills and pass criteria; execute at least one drill.
Acceptance Criteria: Drill executed successfully; pass criteria met; lessons documented.

Summary: Tri-Pane UI + Explain This View (Frontend Extension)
Description: Plugin renders synchronized timeline/map/graph panes with brushing + explainer panel (XAI overlays, provenance tooltips). Repo: plugins/tri-pane-explain/. Zero edits to core UI; module federation only.
Epic Name: Tri-Pane UI + Explain This View (Frontend Extension)
Acceptance Criteria: Zero edits to core UI; module federation only. Accessibility audits pass; screenshots diff-stable. Metrics emitted to OPS pack.

Description: Implement registerUiExtension('tri-pane') entry; persisted queries (read-only).
Epic Link: Tri-Pane UI + Explain This View (Frontend Extension)
Acceptance Criteria: Extension registers correctly; queries are read-only; no core UI edits.

Summary: UI-2: Brushing and linking across panes
Description: Implement brushing & linking across panes; undo/redo; saved views with diff.
Epic Link: Tri-Pane UI + Explain This View (Frontend Extension)
Acceptance Criteria: Select on timeline filters map/graph within 50ms budget (local). Saved view diff shows UI + query changes.

Summary: UI-3: Explainer panel with provenance tooltips
Description: Implement explainer panel with provenance tooltips; integrate with NLQ (EPIC 2).
Epic Link: Tri-Pane UI + Explain This View (Frontend Extension)
Acceptance Criteria: 'Explain' shows inputs, steps, citations; missing proof blocks publish.

Summary: UI-4: Accessibility AAA and keyboard navigation
Description: Ensure A11y AAA compliance, keyboard-first nav, command palette hooks.
Epic Link: Tri-Pane UI + Explain This View (Frontend Extension)
Acceptance Criteria: Accessibility audits pass AAA; full keyboard navigation; command palette integrated.

Description: Add instrumentation for TTFI, path discovery, task-time reduction.
Epic Link: Tri-Pane UI + Explain This View (Frontend Extension)
Acceptance Criteria: Metrics emitted to OPS pack; dashboards show TTFI and task times.
